Dialogue.NPCText:
A gentle, luminous woman stands before the lantern-lit shrine. Cherry blossoms drift in the breeze as she bows in welcome.

“Welcome, seeker. I am Kaoru, Keeper of the Lantern and servant of Amateru, the rising sun.
Have you come for wisdom, for solace, or does your path lead you to the shadows now stirring across our land?”

Option.text: Are the rumors of Minax true?
Do you need help with anything?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kaoru’s eyes soften as the lantern’s glow deepens.

“Each soul that enters Hinokami carries burdens—some old, some newly sown by Minax’s darkness. Speak your mind. What weighs upon you?”

Option.text: I fear the shadow growing in the land.
I have lost someone to Minax’s cult.
I wish to help fight the darkness.
Thank you, Kaoru. That is enough.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kaoru closes her eyes, whispering a prayer.

“Last night, I saw a vision of lanterns flickering in a sea of fog, each threatened by hungry shadows. Yet one lantern blazed brighter, guiding others through the darkness.
Remember: hope endures so long as one keeps the light. Walk with care—and if you would aid us, there are tasks only the brave can attempt.”

Option.text: What tasks can I help with?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kaoru bows her head.

“The pain Minax has wrought is great, but grief binds us to our humanity. In sorrow, we become lanterns for each other.
If you wish, I will light a lantern in memory of your lost one.”

Kaoru steps to the altar, her voice singing a soft hymn. She lights a golden lantern, its flame pure.

“May their spirit find the path to peace, and may you carry their light within you. When you are ready, I can offer you a task to help restore balance to this land.”
“Then you are welcome here. Rest as long as you need. Should the world’s weight grow too heavy, the shrine’s doors are always open.”

Option.text: Actually, I wish to help after all.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“This shrine was raised for Amateru, sun goddess of Tokuno, whose light dispels even the deepest shadow.
Here, exiles and settlers find hope anew, and ancient rituals safeguard Hinokami’s spirit.
Sometimes, I share visions with Shaman Nura of the Verdant Tribes—a sign that darkness threatens more than just our town.”

Option.text: What visions do you share with Shaman Nura?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kaoru’s expression grows grave.

“Shaman Nura and I see the same darkness crawling from the east—corruption spreading through root and spirit alike.
We believe a relic lost from Tokuno, the Sunfire Mirror, may be needed to banish this evil.
If you would help us, I can tell you more.”

Option.text: Tell me of this Sunfire Mirror.
I am not ready for such a quest.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“The Sunfire Mirror once captured the first rays of dawn in Tokuno. It is said to reflect not just light, but truth—burning away all illusion.
I fear Minax’s agents have stolen it and now hide it within the haunted groves of the Verdant Tribes’ lands.
Would you seek it out and return it to this shrine?”

Option.text: Yes, I will recover the Sunfire Mirror.
That sounds dangerous. What will I face?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“The haunted groves are home to vengeful spirits and Minax cultists. You must also earn the trust of the Verdant shamans, or risk their wrath.
Use this blessed lantern to guide your path—it will reveal hidden dangers for a short time. If you are prepared, I shall grant you the quest.”

Option.text: I am ready. Grant me the quest.
I will wait until I am better prepared.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kaoru bows deeply, placing a slip of parchment and a blessed lantern in your hands.
“May Amateru’s light guard you. Return with the Sunfire Mirror and balance may yet be restored.”
Quest Started: Sunfire Mirror

Option.text: I will return with the relic.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Offerings of rice, incense, or cherry blossoms are welcome here. Should you wish, I will bless you in Amateru’s name.”

Kaoru marks your brow with sacred ash.
“Walk with the wisdom of the sun for a time. May your spirit shine bright.”

“Amateru is the radiant sun, goddess of beginnings and hope. Her warmth kindles courage in every heart.
Many in Hinokami follow her path—seeking harmony, compassion, and the power to banish darkness.”

Option.text: Thank you. I would help in any way I can.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kaoru’s voice grows somber.
“Minax is real, and her shadow deepens daily. Many have fallen—some to her promises, others to despair. But light endures.
Already, she corrupts not only the land but the hearts of many. I see her in dreams as a serpent of obsidian, coiling ever closer.”

Option.text: Have you seen her agents here?
I want to help fight her.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Through ritual, vigilance, and unity, we may resist Minax. But we must also seek lost relics and keep our hearts pure. If you aid me in sacred rites, the town’s spirit may yet hold.”

Option.text: What rites can I assist with?

Dialogue.NPCText: “I have seen masked strangers whispering near the river at night, and sacred sigils defiled. The Verdant Tribes warn of the same. Should you uncover signs of Minax’s cult, bring word to me at once.”

Option.text: Can I help root them out?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“There are several ways you may help our cause:
  • Join in a purification ritual to cleanse our lands of shadow.
  • Seek the lost Sunfire Mirror from the haunted groves.
  • Expose and thwart Minax’s agents lurking near our borders.
How would you serve?”

Option.text: Tell me about the purification ritual.
I want to find the Sunfire Mirror.
How can I uncover Minax’s agents?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“We must purify the lantern shrine each week with sacred herbs and a song of dawn. Shadows gather quickly if neglected.
If you bring me 3 bundles of sacred yarrow and join the ritual, Amateru will bless you—and Hinokami’s people will rest easier.”

Option.text: Where can I find sacred yarrow?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kaoru leads you through a solemn ritual, sunlight catching in the lantern’s glass. The air shimmers with warmth.
“Thank you, friend. Amateru’s light grows stronger thanks to your efforts. This lantern will protect you on shadowed paths.”
“Yarrow grows near forest streams at dawn, or can sometimes be bartered from Verdant herbalists. Take care—Minax’s agents have poisoned some groves.”

Option.text: I will return when I have the yarrow.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Minax’s agents are cunning. Look for strange sigils, whispered messages, or those who shun the light. If you uncover proof—a cultist’s token, or their codebook—bring it to me. You will be rewarded for your vigilance.”

Option.text: I will search for signs of the cult.
Do you know what their tokens look like?

Dialogue.NPCText: “Their tokens are often black stones etched with serpentine runes. Some wear pendants of obsidian or carry scrolls tainted by shadow magic.”

Option.text: Thank you, I will keep watch.

Dialogue.NPCText: Kaoru bows gently. “May the sun light your path, traveler. Should you need solace or purpose, return to this lantern’s glow.”

Kaoru smiles softly, the lantern’s glow reflecting in her eyes.

“My story? I am but a humble keeper of light, yet I see that you seek more than surface truths. Would you hear of my past in Tokuno, or the things I hold dear?”

Option.text: Tell me about your past in Tokuno.
Do you ever have doubts about your path?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kaoru’s voice grows distant, as if carried by a warm breeze.

“I was once a shrine maiden in the temples of Tokuno, where I learned to tend lanterns of eternal flame. When Minax’s shadow touched our homeland, I was among the few chosen to lead refugees here.
My lantern is the last relic of the Amateru shrine—its flame has never gone out, not even across the seas.”

Option.text: I want to hear about something else.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Escape was no simple feat. We disguised our pilgrimage as traders and sailed under false banners. I still remember the night sky burning as Minax’s forces razed the temple. The screams of the spirits... I vowed then to never let Amateru’s flame fade.”
A faint tremor shakes her hands before she composes herself.

Option.text: That is a heavy burden to bear.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Difficult, yes, but suffering sharpens resolve. Every blossom that blooms here in Hinokami is a promise that Tokuno’s spirit lives on. We will not let Minax destroy what we hold sacred.”

Option.text: What is most sacred to you?

Dialogue.NPCText: “A burden, yes. But also a lantern I carry for others. When I waver, I remember the faces of those we lost and those still looking to me for light.”

Option.text: Let us speak of something lighter.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kaoru’s expression softens, and she chuckles quietly.

“You wish to know what brings me joy? Even in dark times, there are simple pleasures that remind us why we fight for life. Which would you like to hear about?”

Option.text: What simple pleasures do you enjoy?
Do you ever laugh or find humor?

Dialogue.NPCText: “I find peace in tending the shrine’s garden. Cherry blossoms, when they fall, remind me of the fleeting beauty of life. Sometimes, I watch the stars from the shrine’s roof, singing quiet songs of the sun goddess.”

Option.text: I’d like to help in your garden.
That sounds lovely. Tell me of your songs.

Dialogue.NPCText: “If you bring me <BASEFONT COLOR='#f9e784'>a handful of cherry blossoms</BASEFONT>, I will show you a prayer of renewal and gift you a token of Amateru.”

Option.text: Where can I find cherry blossoms?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kaoru weaves the petals into a small charm, blessing it with a quiet prayer.
“This charm carries a trace of the sun goddess’s warmth. May it protect you.”
“Cherry blossoms bloom near the river east of Hinokami, though they are delicate and fall quickly. Look at dawn for the freshest blooms.”
“Our songs are sung at dawn, welcoming the sun’s first light. If you wish, I can teach you a chant. It will grant you a brief blessing.”

Option.text: I would like to learn the chant.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kaoru’s voice rises in a haunting melody, and you feel a warm resonance within.
“The chant is yours now. Use it to focus your spirit when the path grows dark.”
“I paint scenes of dawn and dusk when I have time. Each stroke is a prayer. If you bring me rare pigments, I could make a painting for you.”

Option.text: I am no artist, but I admire your dedication.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Sacred pigments can be made from crushed fireflies and special dyes. If you find them, bring me <BASEFONT COLOR='#f9e784'>3 rare firefly dyes</BASEFONT>.”

Kaoru unveils a beautiful painting, glowing faintly.
“May this bring warmth to your home or travels.”
“Fireflies glow in the forests near Yew during warm nights. Traders sometimes sell their dyes in Hinokami’s market.”
Kaoru laughs softly. “Even lantern keepers can laugh. The samurai here tell terrible jokes, but their spirit lightens our burdens.”

Option.text: I see your humor is subtle.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Kaoru tilts her head. “Why did the shadow refuse to duel at dawn?
...Because it didn’t want to be outshined!”

She chuckles at her own joke.

A shadow passes over Kaoru’s face.

“Yes, I have doubts. What kind of priestess watches her homeland burn and can do nothing? But I believe Amateru’s light chose me to be here, to guide others.”

Option.text: Do you ever wish for another life?

Dialogue.NPCText: “Sometimes I dream of being a simple painter, traveling the countryside with no burden but my art. But duty calls, and so I remain. Perhaps in another life.”

Option.text: Perhaps I can bring you some pigments for your art.
You are where you are needed.
